diff_hunk:
@@ -1960,11 +1960,7 @@ def pairwise_distance(x1, x2, p=2, eps=1e-6):
         >>> output = F.pairwise_distance(input1, input2, p=2)
         >>> output.backward()
     """
-    assert x1.size() == x2.size(), "Input sizes must be equal."
-    assert x1.dim() == 2, "Input must be a 2D matrix."
-    diff = torch.abs(x1 - x2)
-    out = torch.pow(diff + eps, p).sum(dim=1, keepdim=True)
body: If any users use `pairwise_distance` right now (the non-legacy version) we'll be breaking their code. Not sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing. We should definitely keep the legacy code the same, it's there for interfacing with users of lua torch.
body_html: If any users use pairwise_distance right now (the non-legacy version) we'll be breaking their code. Not sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing. We should definitely keep the legacy code the same, it's there for interfacing with users of lua torch.
body_text: If any users use pairwise_distance right now (the non-legacy version) we'll be breaking their code. Not sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing. We should definitely keep the legacy code the same, it's there for interfacing with users of lua torch.
